issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: A resource with a tag that has \ (backslash) chars in the key cannot be updated or removed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.summary: Tag editor escapes the ' (single quote) char

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
For instance, on the security group detail page, or the instance detail page, as soon as a tag is created with " (double quote) included, the page fails to display all the tags.

when checked with euca2ools, the tag exists; it seems like the display failure on the UI.
fields.summary: in tag editor, when " (double quote) is used, it hides all tags from display

comments.body: Since the tags do not get displayed, there is no way for users to interact with the tags; cannot delete the troublesome tag.
In the worse case, since there are no tag displayed, and ends up adding a new tag. Then, the entire previous tags get lost, and replaced with only the newly added tag.

\ (backward slash) char has the same impact. Once it gets created, the UI cannot display the tags.

Checked on euca2ools:

TAG	security-group	sg-bc0d02f6	backslash	\1
[~kyolee], [~jloza]: How often will a tag key or value (or a name) contain a double quote char?  We should be able to fix this easily for the tag editor--just need to know if it's critical for 4.0.
Seems unlikely to me, I would vote to push to 4.0.1
[~jloza]: Ok, and entering a backslash character in a tag key/value or name is probably unlikely as well, right?

[~kgill][~jloza] The issue here is that if someone makes a mistake of entering " in the tag, it would make the entire list of the tags for this resource to disappear, and as result, the user is no longer able to recover from the issue since the tag editor will no longer display the tags, thus cannot delete the tag that's causing the issue.
[~kyolee], [~jloza]: Ok, if the user is unable to recover from that error, we should fix this in 4.0.  Will prepare a branch/PR ahead of the next bug scrub.
[~kgill] sounds good, please check with [~alice] re: test impact so we know everything we need to know.

[~kgill], is this fix fairly localized? Will things other than tagging be affected?  
Would you say this a low-risk fix?

This is a low-risk fix, but it also affects escaping double-quotes in the Name field for the instance, volume, and snapshot detail page.  A similar fix was pushed for GUI-839, which hasn't caused any regressions AFAICT.

[~alice], [~kyolee]: Got a low-risk fix for this at https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/634

Note that the PR only escapes double quotes and backslash in tags for the tag editor.  No changes were required for the instance, volume, and snapshot name edit.

[~kgill] Tested the branch GUI-852 and verified the fix that the tag editor was able to accept the char " (double quote) and \ (backslash) without impacting the view of the other existing tags.

However, one issue that was noticed was that once a tag is created with the char \ (backslash) included, it cannot be deleted using the UI. When tried to delete, the server returns a success message, but the tags with the \ chars remain displayed with the resource.

Fix is at https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/634

Known issues:
- We are able to delete tags with a backslash in the value, but not in the key, possibly due to a boto issue handling backslashes.
- We are unable to delete an autoscaling tag with a backslash in the tag key or value, possibly due to a boto issue

[~kyolee]: Could we confirm if we're able to delete a tag with a backslash in the key via euca2ools?
[~kgill] Checked with euca2ools and verified that euca2ools is also not able to delete a tag whose key contains the \ char.

[~kgill] The downside of not able to delete the key with a backslash is that, on the UI, when tried to modify a resource's tags and one of them happened to be the tag with the \ on its key, then any following update of the tags on the resource will delete all the tags except the one with the \ in the key.

In other words, once a resource is tagged with the key with the \ char, then any following update on the resource would end up deleting all the tags.

BEFORE:

[root@d-18 ~]# euca-describe-group sg-9695ed7b
GROUP	sg-9695ed7b	570856912786	test only group	test only	
PERMISSION	570856912786	test only group	ALLOWS	tcp	22	22	FROM	CIDR	10.8.0.30/32	ingress
TAG	security-group	sg-9695ed7b	1	2
TAG	security-group	sg-9695ed7b	3	4
TAG	security-group	sg-9695ed7b	7	8
TAG	security-group	sg-9695ed7b	\5	6

AFTER trying to delete the tag 7=8 on the UI, notice all the tags were deleted:

[root@d-18 ~]# euca-describe-group sg-9695ed7b
GROUP	sg-9695ed7b	570856912786	test only group	test only	
PERMISSION	570856912786	test only group	ALLOWS	tcp	22	22	FROM	CIDR	10.8.0.30/32	ingress
TAG	security-group	sg-9695ed7b	\5	6

[~kyolee]: Ok, we should open a separate ticket for the backslash in tag key issue.  It's unlikely we'll be able to fix that in 4.0 though since it appears to be a problem in euca2ools and/or the backend as well.

In addition to the issue in the comment above, it was also noticed that it's not just the tag update that becomes malfunctional under the existence of a tag with a \ char in the key, the entire update operations on the resource would become disabled due to the error. For instance, for a security group, it becomes no longer able to update the inbound rules since any update attempt would result in the 404 Not Found page.

Filed a new EUCA ticket related to the issue:

https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/browse/EUCA-9255

[~kgill] mentioned in the pull request. Please feel free to merge the branch if no additional work is to be added.

In addition to filing the EUCA ticket, due to the level of critically of this issue, we will need to document and warn other euca folks about the known issue that having the \ (backslash) char in the tag's key would cause the detail pages and the tag editors to malfunction.
The fix has been merged and verified. Be aware of the known issues mentioned in the comments above.
